S

setD(double) - Method in class org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.lib.math.MiniPID
Changes the D parameter
This has two primary effects: Adds a "startup kick" and speeds up system response during setpoint changes Adds "drag" and slows the system when moving toward the target A small D value can be useful for both improving response times, and preventing overshoot.
setDirection(boolean) - Method in class org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.lib.math.MiniPID
Set the operating direction of the PID controller
setF(double) - Method in class org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.lib.math.MiniPID
Configure the FeedForward parameter.
setI(double) - Method in class org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.lib.math.MiniPID
Changes the I parameter
This is used for overcoming disturbances, and ensuring that the controller always gets to the control mode.
setMaxIOutput(double) - Method in class org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.lib.math.MiniPID
Set the maximum output value contributed by the I component of the system This can be used to prevent large windup issues and make tuning simpler
setOutputFilter(double) - Method in class org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.lib.math.MiniPID
Set a filter on the output to reduce sharp oscillations.
setOutputLimits(double) - Method in class org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.lib.math.MiniPID
Specify a maximum output range.
setOutputLimits(double, double) - Method in class org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.lib.math.MiniPID
Specify a maximum output.
setOutputRampRate(double) - Method in class org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.lib.math.MiniPID
Set the maximum rate the output can increase per cycle.
This can prevent sharp jumps in output when changing setpoints or enabling a PID system, which might cause stress on physical or electrical systems.
setP(double) - Method in class org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.lib.math.MiniPID
Configure the Proportional gain parameter.
setPID(double, double, double) - Method in class org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.lib.math.MiniPID
Configure the PID object.
setPID(double, double, double, double) - Method in class org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.lib.math.MiniPID
Configure the PID object.
setSetpoint(double) - Method in class org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.lib.math.MiniPID
Configure setpoint for the PID calculations
This represents the target for the PID system's, such as a position, velocity, or angle.
setSetpointRange(double) - Method in class org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.lib.math.MiniPID
Set a limit on how far the setpoint can be from the current position
Can simplify tuning by helping tuning over a small range applies to a much larger range.
shortestAngleRemapped(double, double) - Static method in class org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.lib.math.MathUtils
Finds a value from -1 to 1 representing how much the robot needs to turn to reach the given target angle
smallestDiff(int[], int) - Static method in class org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.lib.math.MathUtils
returns the number in an array closest to the given value
sqr(double) - Static method in class org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.lib.math.MathUtils
squares a double
sqr(int) - Static method in class org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.lib.math.MathUtils
squares an int
